author: ringstrom
msg: Fix issue #1854 (user data loss on case-insensitive file systems)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_crawler.c
(report_revisions): Call svn_io_check_path for entries that appear
to be missing to be sure that they are really missing.

author: ringstrom
msg: Revert r9714 because it's too expensive to call svn_io_check_path
on all directory entries.  A better fix will be committed shortly.

author: ringstrom
msg: Fix issue #1854 (user data loss on case-insensitive file systems)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_crawler.c
(report_revisions): Call svn_io_check_path for each entry instead of
calling svn_io_get_dirents and comparing strings.

author: breser
msg: Revert r9630.
* build/buildcheck.sh
NEON_LATEST_WORKING_VER is only used to generate documentation.  So it was
correct.

author: jpieper
msg: Expose svn_opt_parse_path as a new external API.  This was originally
the static function parse_path in libsvn_subr/opt.c.  The diff
handling routine had duplicated this, and merge would have had to as
well, so let's all use a common implementation.
* subversion/include/svn_opt.h
(svn_opt_parse_path): New, same arguments as the old parse_path.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/opt.c
(parse_path, svn_opt_parse_path): Renamed parse_path to
svn_opt_parse_path, updated all callers.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/diff-cmd.c
(parse_path): Removed.
(svn_cl__diff): Use the new svn_opt_parse_path instead of a local
parse_path.
